Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2017 06:27AM Milnic wrote: I found a a hard immobile lump last Wednesday evening, doctor appt Thursday, ultrasound booked on the Friday as I’m only 34. Radiologists then ordered a mammogram and a core needle biopsy as the mass was suspicious looking. Mammogram showed a lubulated spiculate Mass of malignant appearance with indeterminate microcalifications. Waiting for my biopsy results as they shut over the weekend and I think I may go crazy! Hoping everyone else gets Benign results x
Posts.Title: Core needle biopsy Faireygoddess Ozarkgirl

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2017 06:13PM Milnic wrote: fairygodess Same I just want my results no matter which way they give them to me. I’m a nurse so could technically look them up myself but of course don’t want to breach any hospital protocols. Hoping today or tomorrow to have some answers! My lump is at 12 o’clock and I am extremely bruised and sore as they had difficulty actually getting the needle into the mass as it had a thick fiborus covering and the needle kept bouncing off sorrel like I was stabbed a hundred times. Fingers crossed for you and hopefully results come soon x And thanks ladies, Netflix and dog walks are my best friends at the moment in between looking after my little ones
Posts.Title: Core needle biopsy Faireygoddess Ozarkgirl

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2017 07:20PM Milnic wrote: I’m so sorry to hear that sending you so many good vibes and prayers xxx I got mixed results, my biopsy was inconclusive, showed atypical cells highly probable of malignancy (whatever finding that is) but didn’t have a big enough sample size to make an actual diagnosis. Repeat biopsy isn’t an option as they had so much difficulty in getting a sample the first time. I am booked in for a lumpectomy and sentinel node bx on the 24th so then a week after that I will finally find out what I am dealing with! good luck with your treatment to come x
